abstract: Homeland Security Dept says it will end long-term detention of mothers and children caught crossing United States border illegally, instead releasing them on bond after they pass preliminary interview; change is part of effort to reduce extended detention of families, for which Obama administration has been criticized.
lead_paragraph: Homeland Security officials announced plans to end the long-term detention of mothers with children caught crossing the border illegally by allowing most to be released on bond.

headline.main: U.S. to Reduce Long Stays for Families at Immigration Centers
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Reduce Long Stays for Families at Borders
